statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: UMass 79, Cent Connecticut 66
article.story: UNCASVILLE, Conn. (AP) -- Rashaun Freeman had 23 points and Massachusetts came back in the second half Saturday to beat Central Connecticut 79-66 in a game played at the Mohegan Sun Arena. The Minutemen (8-2) used a 19-7 run to build a 14-point lead before coasting home. Stephane Lasme had 19 points for UMass (8-2), and Gary Forbes had 11 points and eight assists. Central's Tristan Blackwood led all scorers with 25 points, hitting six of 10 shots from 3-point range. Central (3-6) led 38-34 after Jemino Sobers' traditional 3-point play with 18:08 left in the game, and a 3-pointer by Blackwood 23 seconds later made it 41-36. But UMass took over from there. Freeman scored six straight points to turn a one-point deficit into a 53-48 UMass lead at the 8:53 mark. The Blue Devils pulled to within two on a Blackwood three, but UMass then went on a 7-0 run, getting the ball inside and converting free throws. A three by James Life made it 65-53 with 5:55 left. Central took an early 8-4 lead, but UMass answered with an 11-0 run highlighted by a pair of threes from James Life. The teams were tied 30-30 at halftime.
